alert.note: Alert for Dakota; Dixon (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 12 at 5:27AM CDT until July 12 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 AM CDT FOR WESTERN CHEROKEE...WESTERN WOODBURY...SOUTHEASTERN SIOUX... PLYMOUTH...DAKOTA...EASTERN DIXON AND SOUTHERN UNION COUNTIES... At 525 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles south of Granville to near Hinton to near Winnebago, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Remsen and Marcus around 530 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Moville, Cleghorn, Kingsley, Pierson and Larrabee. At 514 pm CDT, a 59 mph wind gust was measured by a personal weather station 2 miles west of McCook Lake. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across extreme southeast South Dakota, northeast Nebraska and through the Highway 60 and 75 corridor in northwest Iowa. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
